ctl:test.name: dims:main
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Support for dimensional data is correct.

ctl:test.name: dims:missing-no-default
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a layer that has a dimension without a default value is requested without supplying the dimension parameter, the response is an exception with code=MissingDimensionValue.

xsl:when.ctl:message: No Named layers that have a dimension without a default value.

ctl:test.name: dims:terrain
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Support for a raster layer that supports the elevation dimension is correct.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: No layers titled cite:Terrain that support the elevation dimension.

ctl:test.name: dims:terrain-low-range
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When elevations in a low range are requested, only the matching pixels are returned.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Method: Request ELEVATION=0/200 and verify that the pixels in the "low spot" are solid and all the other pixels are transparent.

ctl:test.name: dims:terrain-mid-range
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When elevations in a mid range are requested, only the matching pixels are returned.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Method: Request ELEVATION=200/335 and verify that the pixels in the "low spot" and the "high spot" are transparent and all the other pixels are solid.

ctl:test.name: dims:terrain-high-range
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When elevations in a high range are requested, only the matching pixels are returned.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Method: Request ELEVATION=335/425 and verify that the pixels in the "low spot" are solid and all the other pixels are transparent.

ctl:test.name: dims:terrain-low-and-high-ranges
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When elevations in a low range and a high range are requested, only the matching pixels are returned.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Method: Request ELEVATION=0/200,335/425 and verify that the pixels in the "low spot" and the "high spot" are solid and all the other pixels are transparent.

ctl:test.name: dims:terrain-range-and-value
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When elevations in an interval range and at a single value are requested, only the matching pixels are returned.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Method: Request ELEVATION=0/200,250 and verify that all of the pixels in the "low spot" as well as some of the other pixels are not transparent.

ctl:test.name: dims:terrain-value
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When elevations at a single value are requested, only the matching pixels are returned.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Method: Request ELEVATION=250 and verify that some pixels in the response are not transparent.

ctl:test.name: dims:terrain-invalid
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When an elevation outside of the advertised range is requested, the response is an exception with code=InvalidDimensionValue.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Method: Request ELEVATION=1000 and verify that the service returns an exception with code=InvalidDimensionValue.

ctl:test.name: dims:terrain-default
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When the elevation parameter is missing but there is a default elevation value, the default value is used and a warning header is set.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Method: Submit a request without an ELEVATION parameter and verify that the response is equivalent to the default value and the "default value used" warning header is returned.

xsl:if.test: not($response/response/headers/header[@name='Warning' and starts-with(functions:to-lowercase(.), '99 default value used: elevation=0/425') and starts-with(., '99 D')])
xsl:if.ctl:message: A correct "Default value used" warning header was not set

ctl:test.name: dims:terrain-and-other-layer
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a terrain layer that supports elevation and a layer that does not support elevation are both requested, the response is a map.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Method: Submit a request involving both the Terrain layer and a layer that does not support the ELEVATION dimension and verify that the response is a map.

ctl:test.name: dims:geometry
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Support for a geometric layer that supports the elevation dimension is correct.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: No layers titled cite:Lakes that support the elevation dimension.

ctl:test.name: dims:geometry-low
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When the geometry at a low elevation is requested, the matching pixels are returned.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Method: Request ELEVATION=480 and verify that the response is correct.

ctl:test.name: dims:geometry-med
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When the geometry at a medium elevation is requested, the matching pixels are returned.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Method: Request ELEVATION=490 and verify that the response is correct.

ctl:test.name: dims:geometry-high
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When the geometry at a high elevation is requested, the matching pixels are returned.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Method: Request ELEVATION=500 and verify that the response is correct.

ctl:test.name: dims:geometry-multiple-values
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When the geometries for a list of elevations are requested and multiple values are not supported, the response is an exception with code=InvalidDimensionValue.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Method: Request ELEVATION=500,480 and verify that the response is an exception with code=InvalidDimensionValue.

ctl:test.name: dims:geometry-nearest-value
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a request for the geometry at an unadvertised elevation value is requested and support for nearest values is advertised, the nearest value is used and a warning header is set.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Method: Submit a request with ELEVATION=492 and verify that the response is equivalent to the 490 value and the "nearest value used" warning header is returned.

xsl:if.test: not($response/response/headers/header[@name='Warning' and starts-with(functions:to-lowercase(.), '99 nearest value used: elevation=490') and starts-with(., '99 N')])
xsl:if.ctl:message: A correct "Nearest value used" warning header was not set

ctl:test.name: dims:geometry-default-value
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When the elevation parameter is missing but there is a default elevation value, the default value is used and a warning header is set.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Method: Submit a request without an ELEVATION parameter and verify that the response is equivalent to the default value and the "default value used" warning header is returned.

xsl:if.test: not($response/response/headers/header[@name='Warning' and starts-with(functions:to-lowercase(.), '99 default value used: elevation=500') and starts-with(., '99 D')])
xsl:if.ctl:message: A correct "Default value used" warning header was not set

ctl:test.name: dims:geometry-and-other-layer
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a geometry layer that supports elevation and a layer that does not support elevation are both requested, the response is a map.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Method: Submit a request invloving both the Lakes layer and a layer that does not support the ELEVATION dimension and verify that the response is a map

ctl:test.name: dims:time
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Support for a layer that supports the time dimension is correct.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: No layers titled cite:Autos that support the time dimension.

ctl:test.name: dims:time-each-instant
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: For time instant {$instant-num}, the appropriate map is returned.

ctl:test.name: dims:time-interval
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: For a time interval, the appropriate map is returned.

ctl:test.name: dims:time-interval-and-instant
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: For a time value consiting of a time interval and a time instant, the appropriate map is returned.

ctl:test.name: dims:time-interval-list
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: For a time value consiting of a list of time intervals, the appropriate map is returned.

ctl:test.name: dims:time-instant-list
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: For a time value consiting of a list of time instants, the appropriate map is returned.

ctl:test.name: dims:time-current-instant
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: If the time dimension supports the current keyword, a request for TIME=current returns a map.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Method: If the dimension decalaration sets the current attribute, submit a request with TIME=current and verify that the service returns a map

xsl:when.ctl:message: No Named layers that support the current keyword for the time dimension.

ctl:test.name: dims:time-current-interval
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: If the time dimension supports the current keyword and advertises an interval ending with current, a request for that interval returns a map.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Method: If the dimension decalaration sets the current attribute and advertises an interval ending with current, submit a request with TIME=current and verify that the service returns a map

xsl:when.ctl:message: No Named layers that advertise an interval ending with current for the time dimension.

ctl:test.name: dims:time-default
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: If the dimension decalaration includes a default value, a request without a TIME parameter returns a map and sets the "default value used" warning header.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Method: If the dimension decalaration includes a default value, submit a request without a TIME parameter and verify that the service returns a map and sets the "default value used" warning header

xsl:when.ctl:message: No Named layers with a default value for the time dimension.

xsl:if.test: not($response/response/headers/header[@name='Warning' and starts-with(., '99 D') and starts-with(functions:to-lowercase(.), '99 default value used: time=') and starts-with(substring(., 29), $dimension/@default)])
xsl:if.ctl:message: A correct "Default value used" warning header was not set

ctl:test.name: dims:time-and-other-layer
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a layer that supports time and other layers that do not support time are requested, the response is a map.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Method: Submit a request involving both the Autos layer and a layer that does not support the TIME dimension and verify that the response is a map
